intro: Erysimum riphaeanum, commonly known as the alpine wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its flowers are usually bright yellow or orange, with four petals arranged in a cross shape, a characteristic feature of the Brassicaceae family. Erysimum riphaeanum is often used in rock gardens due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
